title: When you think you are hearing weird noises, music, or someone talking while water or the heater is running are those auditory hallucinations? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Not necessarily. Its auditory misperception, but if you actually believe that its music versus the water running that could indicate a precursor to more serious “misperceptions”. In your case, you are identifying what is triggering them, therefore it is not mental illness. You could have a sensory disorder though - this sometimes happens with misuse of certain drugs like Lyrica, or sometimes Amphetamines. It could be genetic as well. It could be too much Copper has weakened your ability to correctly ‘filter’ information…you could ask your Doc for a hair/blood Copper test or overall “heavy metals test” to see if there is an issue. I have also experienced it and I couldn't find satisfying explanation from google but there are quite a lot of people experience it as well. In the running water, electric fan, the rain. One time I heard voices of women chanting prayers when the rain was pouring down hard. I was really scared and started panicking that I texted a friend about it. She just told me to pray because she assumed it was something supernatural. I still don't know what causes this. I do experience mild to moderate psychosis including auditory hallucination but I feel like there's somewhat different explanation for these “voices in the water”.
Yes I think so. Your brain is trying to make sense of white noise and organizing it into recognizable sounds.

The best bet would be to talk to your doctor. There can be a lot of different causes. Stress, meds, hearing issues, etc. It is hard to say. Generally speaking, hallucinations can be a sign of psychosis, but there can be other explanations.
